intro: Tibouchina nodosa, commonly known as the pink glorybower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple bracts that resemble petals. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 3 meters, with opposite, ovate leaves that are glossy and dark green. Tibouchina nodosa produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, often blooming in late spring to early summer. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
